page.title: 11 TRADE IN WOODBRIDGE.
page.content: Woodbridge is a small town on the River Deben.It has a large variety of shops where you can buy nearly anything.There are as many as 27 clothes shops which tend to be small and expensive.The town caters especially for tourists with coffee houses and gift shops.The streets are small and quaint. { Woodbridge market} is situated on Market Hill on Thursdays from 7am.until 4.30pm.There are a variety of stalls selling goods such as cheeses,books, fruit,vegetables,antiques,clothes,toys and wholefood.Traders come from as far away as Romford and Bury St.Edmunds. One of the largest changes in trading has been the development of the{ Turban Centre} of which Budgen supermarket is a main feature.It employs 50 staff and opens daily from 8.30-5.30,with late night shopping on Thursdays and Fridays
